ygData.subject: Re: EQ - worse rpg ever?
ygData.msgSnippet: Actually, I have never had that happen to me... the one item I accientally looted a corpse that was not my turn, I left the item there...The time I took an
ygData.messageBody:
Actually, I have never had that happen to me... the one item I accientally
looted a corpse that was not my turn, I left the item there...The time I
took an item off a corpse that I THOUGHT was mine... I gave him the bronze
item that it had. The time that a paladin (Ehtaw)took my corpse, and I told
him that it was my turn, HE gave me the 3 items it had and said he was
sorry.

My ranger(Galian) friend told me striaght up if I fought an elephant that he
would sit and watch me die(this was after I made a comment, (kidding) that
we should hunt them (I knew Galian would not do it)). We then had a long IC
discussion on Tuanre and the different forms and what her wishs where ect
ect ect... it was fun it lasted over 10 mins just this discussion.

I am sorry you have gotten bad groups... that happens a lot... I have been
really really lucky with the fact that I started out with a couple of
friends going in, and then even more lucky with the fact that I found others
just recently that I now game with as well... and let me tell ya I do have
fun.... the one thing that I do have some problems with is .... Why am I at
this damn bird village and why in the name of Tunare am I killing this damn
birds for... what did they do.... OR

Why am I killing these damn frog guys????? hmmmm

ahh well cant win them all huh?


Jaxim AND his controller...





>From: Supafly16@...
>Reply-To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] EQ - worse rpg ever?
>Date: Thu, 15 Jul 1999 05:44:50 EDT
>
>From: Supafly16@...
>
> I disagree whole- heartedly. I have played RPGs since the age of 8 (I am
>26
>now), and I have played many multi-player RPGs (when they were first
>invented
>around 1986 or so) where roleplaying was great, and one of them was very
>recent- a year ago to be exact. Of course there were questions where
>someone
>will ask what level you are or the monsters hit points, but there was also
>a
>great deal of roleplaying, so it didnt matter - I have even been OOC on
>*more* then one occasionof times myself. But people were there because it
>was
>a different world to escape to. Norrath to me is an empty world.
> I have never been in a game where so many people ripped me off so they
>can
>get more money to buy that next cool item. I can understand if your
>character is a thief or some other mischievous being that follows a deity
>of
>that sort- but how many times has this happened to you -
> 1) A paladin left you for death while you were fighting off monsters-
>and
>he/she ran without thought of honor or disgrace - as what he would say to
>explain the situation - " I didnt want to lose " a half bar of
>experience''
> 2) A holy cleric said to you "It's a nosave lightstone" in Kerra isle
>(Before nosave lightstones were implemented in Kerra isle)
> 3) A person following a deity of 'goodness' loot every corpse in sight
>even
>though it wasnt his/her turn.
> 4) A person diband your group to join another group for more "
>experience'"
>rather then enjoying the moment of adventurers for the cause of good
>adventure.
> 5) A ranger or druid killing a bear, lion, elephant, etc - for "exp or
>to
>increase my 'tailoring skill' "
> Etc, etc..the list goes on. I expected these things to happen, but I have
>never met a single perons in EQ that actually tried to adhere to their
>character. The world of EQ is full of greed and who can be the next '
>coolest high level character'.
>
> T Alexander
>
